full_text.0: @GreenPowerDK Stalin ødelagde også alt for bønderne. Det kon der hungersnød ud af. Alt det grønne er baseret på løgn desværre
full_text.1: @C_Navarrete30 @McFaul Putin is a mass murderer and war criminal. There's no negotiating with someone who is psychotic. His entire history as a KGB officer is clear. He wants to be Stalin.
full_text.2: @francis_scarr Ah, watching "The Dearh of Stalin" clearly illuminates the complete absurdity of the Soviet state.
full_text.3: @QasimRashid My first thought is a government regime couldn’t survive the backlash from its people from killing this many of its citizens. But I then think of Stalin in USSR.  Polpot in Cambodia. All the leaders under South African apartheid. It could happen.
full_text.4: @Schingkenspigg1 @florafascflayer You calling it “Stalin’s regime” shows the lack of historical knowledge you have on the lived experience of the Soviet people during the Stalin Era. The USSR was democratic, more democratic than any capitalist country in history. Do some research c:
